final_answer.explanation: The 2002 Florida Mr. Basketball is Amar'e Stoudemire, who had a successful NBA career. He was selected as an NBA All-Star six times during his career, specifically in the years 2005, 2007, 2008, 2010, 2011, and 2013. This information is corroborated by multiple sources, including official NBA records, which confirm his All-Star appearances. Stoudemire's impact in the league is further highlighted by his achievements, including being named the NBA Rookie of the Year in 2003 and earning multiple All-NBA Team selections. His consistent performance and recognition as an All-Star reflect his significant contributions to the teams he played for, particularly the Phoenix Suns, where he began his career.

graph.title: Research NBA All-Star History
graph.content: <252>[Research NBA All-Star History] Research the history of NBA All-Star Games to find a list of players who have participated, specifically focusing on the 2002 Florida Mr. Basketball.</252>
graph.answer: Amar'e Stoudemire, the 2002 Florida Mr. Basketball, had a notable NBA career marked by significant achievements. He was selected as the 9th overall pick in the 2002 NBA Draft by the Phoenix Suns. Throughout his career, he played for the Suns, New York Knicks, Dallas Mavericks, and Miami Heat. Stoudemire was recognized for his exceptional performance, earning NBA All-Star selections six times in the years 2005, 2007, 2008, 2010, 2011, and 2012. His accolades also include being named the NBA Rookie of the Year in 2003 and multiple All-NBA Team selections, underscoring his impact in the league.
